info.title: Napi Framework
info.description:
Napi is a RESTful API that powers the delivery of all of the content data used in the CBSSports mobile applications. Requests made to the API and the corresponding responses are in JSON format. Below you can find an interface for exploring the different endpoints offered.

Parameters listed in bold are required for each request. Additionally there are parameters whose allowed values are governed by regular expressions. For both required and regular expression parameters, the input field will be red unless a valid value is provided, in which case it will turn green.

The fields parameter is an optional parameter for all endpoints and can be used to parse certain pieces of information from the response (viewable in the model schema section for each endpoint).

Fields can be specified like so: 
`
fields=parentKey(childKey(grandChildKey)),parentKey...
`

An additional feature of the fields parameter is the option to specify limit or offset when filtering a collection within the response. For example, limit and offset can be specified like this:
`
fields=parentKey(childKey(grandChildKey,limit=n,offset=m))
`

For more information and documentation about Napi, visit http://wiki.cbsig.net/wiki/BackendServices/napi#What_is_Napi.3F

get.summary: Retreive scoreboard data for a variety of parameters
get.description: Used as a replacement for PUFI.  This scoreboard has intelligence such that it KNOWS which sports are in progress during which times.  Therefore, its return is very tailored to only return relevant data.  There is no need for the user to know any information about what week or season a sports is in.  Providing a date is optional, otherwise the "current schedule" is checked.

parameters.name: conferences
parameters.description: Format is league:conf;conf,league2:conf;conf ...  e.g. ncaaf:sec;pac10;top25 (Regular Expression Field)

parameters.name: teams
parameters.description: Format is league:teamId1;teamId2,league2:teamId1;teamId2 ...  e.g. nfl:401,ncaab:205;208 (Regular Expression Field)

parameters.name: games
parameters.description: Format is league:gameId1;gameId2,league2:gameId1;gameId2 ...  e.g. nfl:3587,ncaaf:654;264 (Regular Expression Field)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Format is league:status;status ... Possible values are: scheduled, inprogress or final (Regular Expression Field)

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: How far back in the calendar to go.  Integer in days, e.g. before=5 (days)

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: How far forward in the calendar to go.  Integer in days, e.g. after=5 (days)

parameters.name: timeZone
parameters.description: UTC offset of the caller.  Used with date=YYYYMMDD.  Must have + or - followed by 4 digits.  Colon optional, e.g. -07:00 or -0700

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Get scoreboards based around a specific day in YYYYMMDD format.  Used in combination with before= and after= parameters.

parameters.name: tournament
parameters.description: NCAAB ONLY CURRENTLY -- Get Scoreboard data for a specific tournament. Format is ncaab:<tournament>;tournament (Regular Expression Field)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Filter results to only show these fields from the data. Supports nested structures.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Array results only.  Start at record n

parameters.name: console
parameters.description: Write log entries to the rabbitConsole

get.summary: Returns seasonal information for a sport such that navigation links can be constructed in a UI.
get.description:
Contains no scoring or game specific information.
! At least one of the following fields must be present: seasonYear | date

parameters.name: league
parameters.description: Optional league for the query (case insensitive)

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: A date in YYYYMMDD.  Alternative to seasonYear.  The endpoint will look up the corresponding seasonYear.
